intro: Anneslia papillosa, commonly known as the silky anneslia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive silvery appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Anneslia papillosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
